Title: position(s1 IN s2)
Description: search for string s1 in string s2, when found return the position in s2 of the first match, when not found return 0

Title: repeat(s, nr)
Description: repeat string s the specified nr of times

Title: replace(s, srch, repl)
Description: replace occurrences of string srch in string s by string repl

Title: right(s, int n)
Description: return last n characters in the string

Title: rpad(s, int)
Description: fill up the string to length len by appending spaces. If the string is already longer than length then it is truncated (on the right).

Title: rpad(s1, int len, s2)
Description: fill up the string s1 to length len by appending the characters s2. If the string s1 is already longer than length then it is truncated (on the right).

Title: rtrim(s)
Description: remove trailing whitespace characters from string s

Title: rtrim(s1, s2)
Description: remove trailing s2 strings from string s1

Title: space(nr)
Description: generates a string with nr spaces

Title: splitpart(s, sep, n)
Description: extract substring from string s by spliting on separator string sep the field before nth occurrence. n must be greater than zero

Title: sql_max(s1, s2)
Description: alphabetically ordered last string value of strings s1 and s2

Title: sql_min(s1, s2)
Description: alphabetically ordered first string value of strings s1 and s2

Title: startswith(s1, s2)
Description: whether string s1 starts with string s2. returns null when either s1 or s2 is null

Title: startswith(s1, s2, icase)
Description: whether string s1 starts with string s2 matching case insenstive when icase is true, case sensitive when icase is false. returns null when either s1 or s2 is null

Title: substr(s, startpos)
Description: extract substring starting from position startpos

Title: substr(s, startpos, count)
Description: extract substring starting from position startpos for count characters

Title: substring(s, startpos)
Description: extract substring starting from position startpos

Title: substring(s, startpos, count)
Description: extract substring starting from position startpos for count characters

Title: trim(s)
Description: remove leading and trailing whitespace characters from string s

Title: trim(s1, s2)
Description: remove leading and trailing s2 strings from string s1

Title: "truncate"(s, n_chars)
Description: truncate the string s to a maximum of n_chars characters. Note: the function name truncate need to be surrounded by double quotes.

Title: ucase(s)
Description: convert string s to upper case

Title: upper(s)
Description: convert string s to upper case

Title: levenshtein(s1, s2)
Description: Compute the 'Levenshtein distance' where insertion/deletion and replacement costs are all 1

Title: levenshtein(s1, s2, id, r)
Description: compute the 'Levenshtein distance' between two strings returning the minimum number of single-character edits (insertions, deletions or substitutions) required to change one word into the other.

Title: levenshtein(s1, s2, int id, int r, int t)
Feature: levenshtein(s1, s2, int id, int r, int t)
Description: compute the 'Damerau-Levenshtein distance' between two strings returning the minimum number of single-character edits (insertions, deletions, substitutions and transpositions) required to change one word into the other.

Title: jarowinkler(s1, s2)
Description: compute the 'Jaro-Winkler similarity' between two strings returning a double between 0 (exact match) and 1 (no similarity)

Title: dameraulevenshtein(s1, s2)
Description: Compute the 'Damerau-Levenshtein distance' where insertion/deletion, replacement and transposition costs are all 1

Title: dameraulevenshtein(s1, s2, int id, int r, int t)
Feature: dameraulevenshtein(s1, s2, int id, int r, int t)
Description: compute the 'Damerau-Levenshtein distance' between two strings returning the minimum number of single-character edits (insertions, deletions or substitutions) required to change one word into the other.

Title: editdistance(s1, s2)
Description: compute the 'distance' between two strings returning an integer between 0 (equal) and n (largest distance) where n is the length of largest string

Title: editdistance2(s1, s2)
Description: compute the 'distance2' between two strings returning an integer between 0 (equal) and n (largest distance) where n is the length of largest string

Title: soundex(s)
Description: computes the Soundex code from string s using a phonetic algorithm

Title: difference(s1, s2)
Description: converts two strings s1 and s2 to their soundex codes and reports the number of different code positions. Since soundex codes have four characters, the result ranges from zero to four, with zero being an exact match and four being no match.

Title: qgramnormalize(s)
Description: normalisation of a string s. Converts letters to uppercase and removes all characters not in a..zA..Z0..9 or space

Title: contains(s1, s2)
Description: whether string s1 constains string s2. returns null when either s1 or s2 is null

Title: contains(s1, s2, icase)
Description: whether string s1 constains string s2 matching case insenstive when icase is true, case sensitive when icase is false. returns null when either s1 or s2 is null

Title: dameraulevenshtein(s1, s2, int insdel, int rep, int trans)
Feature: dameraulevenshtein(s1, s2, int insdel, int rep, int trans)
Description: Compute the 'Damerau-Levenshtein distance' between two strings returning the minimum number of single-character edits (insertions/deletions, substitutions and transpositions) required to change one word into the other. Variable costs of insertions/deletions, substitutions and transpositions, with insdel, rep and trans respectively

Title: endswith(s1, s2)
Description: whether string s1 ends with string s2. returns null when either s1 or s2 is null

Title: endswith(s1, s2, icase)
Description: whether string s1 ends with string s2 matching case insenstive when icase is true, case sensitive when icase is false. returns null when either s1 or s2 is null

Title: levenshtein(s1, s2, int insdel, int rep)
Feature: levenshtein(s1, s2, int insdel, int rep)
Description: Compute the 'Levenshtein distance' between two strings returning the minimum number of single-character edits (insertions/deletions or substitutions) required to change one word into the other. Variable costs of insertions/deletions or substitutions, with insdel and rep respectively.

Title: levenshtein(s1, s2, int insdel, int rep, int trans)
Feature: levenshtein(s1, s2, int insdel, int rep, int trans)
Description: compute the 'Damerau-Levenshtein distance' between two strings returning the minimum number of single-character edits (insertions, deletions, substitutions and transpositions) required to change one word into the other.

Title: ascii(s)
Description: Unicode code point of the first character of the string s

Title: asciify(s)
Description: Replace all non-ASCII characters in string s with ASCII equivalents

Title: char_length(s)
Description: number of UTF-8 characters in UTF-8 string s

Title: character_length(s)
Description: number of UTF-8 characters in UTF-8 string s

Title: charindex(substr, s)
Description: start position of substr in string s or 0 when not found

Title: charindex(substr, s, i)
Description: start position of substr in string s starting at offset i or 0 when not found

Title: code(int)
Description: Unicode character for the integer code point

Title: concat(s1, s2)
Description: concatenate strings s1 and s2. returns null when either s1 or s2 is null

Title: field(s, s1, s2, s3, ...)
Description: Returns the index (position) of s in the s1, s2, s3, ... list. Returns NULL if str is not found.

Title: greatest(s1, s2)
Description: alphabetically ordered last string value of strings s1 and s2. (same as sql_max(s1, s2))

Title: insert(s1, int pos, int nr, s2)
Feature: insert(s1, int pos, int nr, s2)
Description: insert string s2 into string s1 after position pos replacing nr characters in string s1. when pos is negative it counts from the end of the string. nr must be >= 0.

Title: lcase(s)
Description: convert string s to lower case

Title: least(s1, s2)
Description: alphabetically ordered first string value of strings s1 and s2. (same as sql_min(s1, s2))

Title: left(s, int n)
Description: return first n characters in the string

Title: length(s)
Description: count number of UTF-8 characters in UTF-8 string s

Title: locate(s1, s2)
Description: locate string s1 in s2, when found return start position else 0

Title: locate(s1, s2, int pos)
Description: locate string s1 in s2 starting from position pos, when found return start position else 0

Title: lower(s)
Description: convert string s to lower case

Title: lpad(s, int len)
Description: fill up the string to length len by prepending spaces. If the string is already longer than length then it is truncated (on the right).

Title: lpad(s1, int len, s2)
Description: fill up the string s1 to length len by prepending the characters s2. If the string s1 is already longer than length then it is truncated (on the right).

Title: ltrim(s)
Description: remove leading whitespace characters from string s

Title: ltrim(s1, s2)
Description: remove leading s2 strings from string s1

Title: sys.md5(s)
Description: calculates the MD5 hash of string, returning the result as 32 character hex number

Title: sys.ms_stuff(varchar(32) s1, int pos, int nr, varchar(32) s2)
Feature: sys.ms_stuff(varchar(32) s1, int pos, int nr, varchar(32) s2)
Description: insert string s2 into string s1 at position pos replacing nr characters in string s1. If pos <= 0 or > length of s1 then an empty string is returned. nr may be negative.

Title: octet_length(s)
Description: number of bytes in UTF-8 string s

Title: patindex(pattern, s)
Description: search for pattern in string s, when found return the position of the last matched character, when not found return 0
